committees.subcommittee: Subcommittee on Public Lands, National Parks and Forests

official_title: A bill to amend the Wild and Scenic Rivers Act by designating a segment of the Rio Grande in New Mexico as a component of the National Wild and Scenic Rivers System, and for other purposes.

summary.text: Rio Grande Designation Act of 1992 - Amends the Wild and Scenic Rivers Act to designate a segment of the Rio Grande, New Mexico, as a component of the National Wild and Scenic Rivers System. Designates another segment of the Rio Grande for potential addition to the System. Directs the Secretary of the Interior to establish the Rio Grande Citizens Oversight Review Board to advise the Secretary on the implementation of a management plan for the designated river segment. Withdraws such lands from appropriation or disposition under U.S. public land, mining, and mineral and geothermal leasing laws.

titles.title: A bill to amend the Wild and Scenic Rivers Act by designating a segment of the Rio Grande in New Mexico as a component of the National Wild and Scenic Rivers System, and for other purposes.
